meanings.definition: To plant different types of plants together in the same area.
meanings.sent1: I will interplant roses and daisies in my garden for a colorful display.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often interplant corn and beans to improve soil quality.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a beautiful patchwork quilt after I interplanted the flowers.
meanings.sent4: She interplanted her herbs and vegetables like a skilled artist blending colors on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: Interplanting creates a harmonious ecosystem where each plant supports the others.

meanings.definition: To plant between or among other plants.
meanings.sent1: The gardener decided to interplant marigolds between the tomato plants.
meanings.sent2: It is beneficial to interplant lettuce among the carrots to maximize space.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to interplant acorns in the flower pots.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to interplant themselves, weaving a natural tapestry in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Interplanting strategically can help prevent pests and diseases from spreading easily.
